SUMMARY: Finland changed its policy toward the military alliance after troops invaded Ukraine. Sweden has avoided all military alliances, but like Finland, has also grown closer and closer to NATO over time.

TITLE: The Buffalo suspect had threatened his high school last year, police say
SUMMARY: Authorities in Buffalo say the alleged gunman had threatened a shooting at his school in 2021. He was then sent for a mental health evaluation that lasted a day and a half.

TITLE: One person was killed in California church shooting, authorities say
SUMMARY: Four others were critically wounded and one other person suffered minor injures, officials said.

TITLE: A WWII veteran meets the man who found and returned his long-lost bracelet
SUMMARY: A Czech hobbyist who returned a Colorado veteran's bracelet he found at a former World War II prisoner of war camp finally got to meet the veteran, traveling halfway around the world to do so.

TITLE: A history professor weighs in on the Buffalo attack and white supremacy
SUMMARY: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Kathleen Belew, an assistant professor of history at the University of Chicago, on the threat of white supremacist movements in the U.S.

TITLE: The war has worsened disparities for women in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Ukrainian feminists say their country came a long way, legally and culturally, in the past decade. Now advocates are trying to address sexual assault, economic hardship and other effects of the war.

TITLE: County official Mark Poloncarz on Buffalo's response to the racist attack
SUMMARY: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Erie County Executive Mark Poloncarz about how the city of Buffalo, New York, is responding to Saturday's shooting.

TITLE: Anger and grief in Buffalo as police call Tops market shooting a hate crime
SUMMARY: Investigators say the 18-year-old man accused in a mass shooting Saturday in Buffalo, New York, scouted the location in advance.

TITLE: One person was killed in a California church shooting, officials say
SUMMARY: Four others were critically wounded and another person suffered minor injures, officials said.

TITLE: What we know about the victims of the Buffalo shooting
SUMMARY: The identities of Buffalo shooting victims have been trickling out, largely through family members speaking to media outlets.

TITLE: What we know so far about the Buffalo mass shooting
SUMMARY: 10 people are dead after an 18-year-old white man allegedly carried out an attack at a supermarket in a majority Black district.

TITLE: What is the 'Great Replacement' and how is it tied to the Buffalo shooting suspect?
SUMMARY: The suspect allegedly wrote a 180-page document filled with hateful rants about race and ties to the conspiracy theory, "Great Replacement".

TITLE: California churchgoers hog-tied gunman in deadly attack
SUMMARY: Four others were critically wounded and another person suffered minor injures, officials said.

TITLE: G7 warn of Ukraine grain crisis, ask China not to aid Russia
SUMMARY: The Group of Seven leading economies warned Saturday that the war in Ukraine is stoking a global food and energy crisis which threatens poor countries.

TITLE: What we know about the suspect in the Buffalo mass shooting
SUMMARY: A white gunman dressed in military-style clothing allegedly killed 10 people at a Buffalo grocery store. Here's what we know about him.

TITLE: U.N. secretary-general calls Buffalo shooting 'vile act of racist extremism'
SUMMARY: António Guterres also extended condolences to the families of the 10 people who were killed in the shooting.

TITLE: Did you see the Super Flower Blood Moon last night? It was stunning
SUMMARY: South America and much of the continental United States had the best view of Sunday night's lunar eclipse, which lasted nearly five hours.

TITLE: These middle school students have a warning about teens and social media
SUMMARY: A group of Texas middle-schoolers won NPR's 4th-annual Student Podcast Challenge, and learned a lesson about fake news and the limits of "talking digitally."

TITLE: Trump-era special counsel faces first real test as Washington attorney goes on trial
SUMMARY: John Durham's probe led to a single false statements count against Michael Sussmann for allegedly lying to the FBI about possible ties between a Russian-bank and Donald Trump's company.

TITLE: Is your house at risk of a wildfire? This online tool could tell you
SUMMARY: Many people move without realizing the danger that wildfires pose to their new home. A new risk rating system could help buyers learn more on real estate sites.

TITLE: This dog broke into a Tennessee couple's house and snuggled her way into their bed
SUMMARY: Julie and Jimmy Johnson woke up to quite the surprise after a night of thunderstorms earlier this month. While they have three dogs of their own, the dog sandwiched between them was a total stranger.

TITLE: After a lockdown, students found comfort in humor. But what are the jokes hiding?
SUMMARY: This year's winner of our Student Podcast Challenge, junior, Teagan Nam, described how their friends and classmates turned to memes and social media as a coping method.

TITLE: Airbnb is renting out the iconic Moulin Rouge for three one-night stays
SUMMARY: The historic space was established as a <a href="https://www.britannica.com/art/cabaret#ref3509">dance hall in 1889

TITLE: Details emerge about the suspect in the Buffalo mass shooting
SUMMARY: A white gunman dressed in military-style clothing allegedly killed 10 people at a Buffalo grocery store. Here's what we know about him.

TITLE: An independent probe points to Israeli gunfire in the death of a journalist
SUMMARY: One open-source research team said its initial findings lent support to Palestinian witnesses who said Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh was killed by Israeli fire.

TITLE: The U.S. will remove 5 groups from its foreign terrorism blacklist
SUMMARY: The United States is poised to remove five extremist groups, all believed to be defunct, from its list of foreign terrorist organizations, including several that once posed significant threats.

TITLE: A substance found in young spinal fluid helps old mice remember
SUMMARY: A team at Stanford University has reversed memory loss in old mice by flooding their brains with spinal fluid taken from young animals. The finding may hold promise for Alzheimer's research.

TITLE: McDonald's is leaving Russia, after more than 30 years
SUMMARY: In 1990, the Big Mac's arrival in Moscow signaled a new era. Now McDonald's is tearing down the golden arches and writing off its investment in Russia.

TITLE: Buffalo victim Roberta Drury, 32, is remembered as a great help to her family
SUMMARY: "She would go to Tops for us all the time, actually," Moyer told NPR. "We don't really have family in the area, so it was just a great help that she could do something for us like that."

TITLE: U.N. secretary-general calls Buffalo shooting 'vile act of racist violent extremism'
SUMMARY: António Guterres also extended condolences to the families of the 10 people who were killed in the shooting.

TITLE: The gunman had plans to continue his rampage, says Buffalo police commissioner
SUMMARY: Had he not been stopped by police, Buffalo Buffalo Police Commissioner Joseph Gramaglia told ABC News on Monday, the alleged perpetrator would have driven away in search of more victims.

TITLE: GOP leadership has enabled white nationalism, Liz Cheney says
SUMMARY: In the wake of the Buffalo supermarket shooting, Cheney is calling on Republican leaders to "renounce and reject" white supremacist views and those who hold them.

TITLE: Ukraine makes advances in the northeast of the country around the city of Kharkiv
SUMMARY: Ukrainian troops are pushing Russian troops away from the country's second largest city. That is allowing residents to move out of subway stations and try to resume something of a normal life.

TITLE: Some are calling the Buffalo suspect a 'teenager.' Is that a privilege of his race?
SUMMARY: The white supremacist suspect in Buffalo is 18 years old.  Some news organizations and commentators have called him a "teenager" and "child" rather than a "man."

TITLE: This forgotten women's prison helped cement Greenwich Village's queer identity
SUMMARY: In his book <em>The Women's House of Detention

TITLE: Parishioners stop gunman in deadly California church attack
SUMMARY: A man opened fire during a lunch reception at a Southern California church, killing one person and wounding five before  parishioners hog-tied him with electrical cords.

TITLE: How the alleged shooter livestreamed the attack, and how sites can stop such videos
SUMMARY: Using a GoPro camera attached to a helmet, the shooter streamed live on the site Twitch for two minutes before the stream was taken down. By then it was too late, and the video has spread elsewhere.

TITLE: Relatives honor Ruth Whitfield, 86, as a devoted mom, wife and grandmother
SUMMARY: Whitfield's children and grandchildren share treasured memories and calls to action at the event with their legal team, led by prominent civil rights attorney Ben Crump.

TITLE: The Buffalo suspect bought a rifle months after cops ordered a psychiatric evaluation
SUMMARY: In June 2021, New York police sent the suspect to a hospital for an evaluation after he made a threat at his school. Then, he fell off of law enforcement's radar and bought a rifle earlier this year.

TITLE: The alleged Buffalo shooter livestreamed the attack. How sites can stop such videos
SUMMARY: Using a GoPro camera attached to a helmet, the shooter streamed live on the site Twitch for two minutes before the stream was taken down. By then it was too late, and the video has spread elsewhere.

TITLE: Ukraine says it's downed 200 aircraft, a mark of Russian failures in the sky
SUMMARY: Russia was expected to dominate the skies over Ukraine. But Ukrainians are still shooting down helicopters and planes, making Russian pilots very wary about venturing into Ukrainian airspace.

TITLE: Hate against Taiwanese led to church attack, authorities say
SUMMARY: A gunman in an attack at a California church was a Chinese immigrant motivated by hate for Taiwanese people, authorities say.

TITLE: Russia-Ukraine war: What happened today (May 16)
SUMMARY: A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: The jury saw pictures of Amber Heard's swollen face after a fight with Johnny Depp
SUMMARY: Jurors in Johnny Depp's libel trial against his ex-wife, Amber Heard, saw photos of her with red marks and swelling on her face after their final fight before their divorce.

TITLE: Some Pennsylvania GOP lawmakers who passed mail-in voting law now want it thrown out
SUMMARY: In a key swing state, Pennsylvania's highest court is weighing a challenge to a state law that's expanded mail-in voting. The challenge was put forth in part by 11 GOP lawmakers who voted for the law.

TITLE: California church shooter was motivated by hate for Taiwanese people, officials say
SUMMARY: A gunman in an attack at a California church was a Chinese immigrant motivated by hate for Taiwanese people, authorities say.

TITLE: Hundreds of Ukrainian soldiers evacuated from steel plant to Russian-held territory
SUMMARY: It's unclear if the soldiers have been taken prisoner or are under the protection of the U.N., but a Ukrainian official says they would be able to return home after a prisoner exchange with Russia.

TITLE: FDA announces plans to ease the shortage of baby formula
SUMMARY: Abbott, one of the largest formula-makers in the U.S., has reached an agreement with the government to bring a closed factory back on line. And the FDA is easing some restrictions on imported formula.

TITLE: Biden eases restrictions on Cuban travel and remittances
SUMMARY: The White House plans to make it easier for families to visit relatives in Cuba and increase visa processing on the island, reversing some of former President Trump's policies.

TITLE: The federal government is offering another round of free COVID tests
SUMMARY: Households in the U.S. will receive eight test kits via the U.S. Postal Service. The release comes as cases have risen over 60% in the U.S. over the past two weeks.

TITLE: Supreme Court sides with Sen. Ted Cruz in campaign finance case
SUMMARY: At issue was a federal law that has been on the books for 20 years that barred federal candidates from raising more than $250,000 to repay loans made to their campaigns.

TITLE: The wildfires burning in the Southwest are bad but 'not unprecedented'
SUMMARY: Experts say the Southwestern U.S. is drier than it's been in some 1,200 years, which is one of, but not the only, drivers of the large infernos burning in New Mexico.

TITLE: President Biden will travel to Buffalo today to meet with shooting victims' families
SUMMARY: Biden will visit the supermarket where last weekend's deadly shooting took place, as well as visit with local leaders and law enforcement.

TITLE: New Zealand shooting survivor says violence achieved nothing
SUMMARY: The deadly attacks at two Christchurch mosques brought people together rather than sowing discord, one of the survivors says.

TITLE: Delaware State University to file a complaint with DOJ after bus search incident
SUMMARY: Tony Allen, Delaware State University's president, says once the complaint is officially filed, it will be made available to the campus community to read.

TITLE: The 'Great Replacement' conspiracy theory isn't fringe anymore, it's mainstream
SUMMARY: A racist conspiracy theory is believed to have motivated the suspected gunman in the Buffalo attack. It was once a fringe belief, but it's found its way into the mainstream.

TITLE: Congressional candidate Alexandra Hunt wants you to look beyond her past
SUMMARY: The 29-year-old looking to unseat Rep. Dwight Evans for Pennsylvania's 3rd Congressional District, has grabbed attention for her past as a stripper and for creating an OnlyFans.

TITLE: From across the Pacific, Taiwan's president castigates California shooting
SUMMARY: The leader of the self-governing East Asian island condemned violence following the deadly attack against a Taiwanese congregation in California.

TITLE: Mastriano, a Trump-backed election denier, leads Pennsylvania GOP field for governor
SUMMARY: Far-right Pennsylvania state Sen. Doug Mastriano is leading polls in the GOP primary for governor, panicking the state's Republican party establishment. Former U.S. Rep. Lou Barletta follows.

TITLE: Far-right challengers look to upset the status quo in the Idaho governor's primary
SUMMARY: In Idaho's GOP race for governor, former President Donald Trump has endorsed Lt. Gov. Janice McGeachin, who has long ties to far-right figures and is challenging incumbent Gov. Brad Little.

TITLE: This school takes kids from the most traumatized parts of Ukraine — and offers hope
SUMMARY: Teachers in Warsaw work to address student-held trauma in classrooms after the Polish school system absorbed tens of thousands of Ukrainian refugee students.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from North Carolina
SUMMARY: Rep. Madison Cawthorn is facing a challenge, supported by major state GOP figures. One Democratic House primary may have been reshaped by the abortion rights debate. And a key Senate race will be set.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from Pennsylvania
SUMMARY: The GOP Senate contest is a tight three-way race, despite Donald Trump trying to boost TV doctor Mehmet Oz. There's also a high-stakes race for governor.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from Kentucky
SUMMARY: Among Kentucky's competitive primaries: U.S. Senate, and Districts 3 and 4 for the U.S. House.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from Idaho
SUMMARY: The governor's race has top billing, as Lt. Gov. Janice McGeachin, who has the endorsement of former President Donald Trump, is challenging sitting Republican Gov. Brad Little.

TITLE: In Oregon, the fight for governor is about winning over disaffected voters
SUMMARY: The Republicans, an independent and a self-proclaimed "outsider" are among the candidates hoping to win over Oregon voters who say they're pessimistic about the future of the state.

TITLE: How the 'Replacement' theory went mainstream on the political right
SUMMARY: The theory began in white supremacist circles and has slowly integrated into the mainstream of Republican politics.

TITLE: 10 races to watch Tuesday, led by Senate contests in Pennsylvania and North Carolina
SUMMARY: Five states hold primaries Tuesday. The top race is in Pennsylvania, where the GOP Senate primary will be another test of Trump's influence, while Democratic voters seem to favor John Fetterman.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from Oregon
SUMMARY: A term-limited Gov. Kate Brown means there's an open race for governor. And Democratic Rep. Kurt Schrader faces a progressive challenger.

TITLE: Elon Musk says doubt about spam accounts could doom Twitter deal
SUMMARY: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says his deal to buy Twitter can't move forward unless the company shows public proof that less than 5% of the accounts on the social media platform are fake or spam.

TITLE: Congress is holding its first UFO hearing in more than 50 years
SUMMARY: The hearing, which will include testimony from military intelligence officials, is the first on the subject since 1969. It will be livestreamed on the House Intelligence Committee's YouTube channel.

TITLE: A suspect has been arrested in a Dallas salon shooting that may be a hate crime
SUMMARY: A suspect has been arrested in connection with a shooting that wounded three women in a hair salon in the city's Koreatown, police said. Possible links to other shootings are being investigated.

TITLE: Hezbollah and its allies lose their majority in Lebanon's parliament
SUMMARY: Lebanon's militant Hezbollah group and its allies lost their parliamentary majority, final elections results showed Tuesday, while more than a dozen independent newcomers gained seats.

TITLE: U.N. and advocates raise concerns of abortion access for Ukrainian refugees in Poland
SUMMARY: Poland's abortion laws are among the strictest in Europe. Advocates are seeking to help Ukrainian refugees who wish to terminate a pregnancy — including women raped by Russian soldiers during the war.

TITLE: A dealer is sentenced to 17.5 years for his role in Mac Miller's fatal overdose
SUMMARY: Stephen Walter was sentenced on Monday. He is one of three men indicted in connection with supplying the fentanyl-laced pills that contributed to the rapper's accidental overdose in 2018.

TITLE: A suspect has been arrested in a Dallas salon shooting investigated as a hate crime
SUMMARY: The arrest was connected to a shooting that wounded three women in a hair salon in the city's Koreatown last week, police said. Federal officials have launched a hate crime investigation.

TITLE: The military's UFO database now has info from about 400 reported incidents
SUMMARY: That's up from 143 incidents in a report issued in 2021. Officials partly credited reducing stigma around the issue for the new reports, many of which are older and went unmentioned at the time.

TITLE: After a stroke blinded one eye, Frank Bruni focused on the future
SUMMARY: The New York Times columnist says the stroke forced him to choose: He could focus on what had been lost, or on what remained. His memoir is The Beauty of Dusk. Originally broadcast March 22, 2022.

TITLE: South Carolina becomes the latest state to enact a transgender sports ban
SUMMARY: South Carolina's governor signed into law a bill that would ban transgender students from playing girls' or women's sports in public schools and colleges.

TITLE: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel and Miranda Kerr paid off art school graduates' student loans
SUMMARY: Spiegel and Kerr, who have been married since 2017, gave the commencement speech and got honorary degrees from Otis College of Art and Design. Then they surprised graduates with a gift of their own.

TITLE: In wave after deadly wave, COVID has claimed 1 million lives in the U.S.
SUMMARY: The virus became the third leading cause of death in the U.S., and caused so many to die in the prime of life that the country experienced the biggest drop in life expectancy since World War II.

TITLE: The 'great replacement' conspiracy theory isn't fringe anymore, it's mainstream
SUMMARY: A racist conspiracy theory is believed to have motivated the suspected gunman in the Buffalo attack. It was once a fringe belief, but it's found its way into the mainstream.

TITLE: Suspect faces multiple charges in a deadly California church shooting
SUMMARY: David Chou, the man accused of opening fire Sunday on a Taiwanese church congregation in California, was charged Tuesday with first-degree murder and five counts of attempted murder.

TITLE: A pro-Trump film suggests its data are so accurate, it solved a murder. That's false
SUMMARY: Conservative commentator Dinesh D'Souza's new film "2,000 Mules" alleges massive voter fraud in the 2020 election, but NPR has found the filmmakers made multiple misleading and false claims.

TITLE: Russia-Ukraine war: What happened today (May 17)
SUMMARY: A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: Eliminating fossil fuel air pollution would save about 50,000 lives, study finds
SUMMARY: Burning oil, coal and other fossil fuels releases plumes of tiny, dangerous particles. A new study estimates that eliminating that pollution would save about 50,000 lives in the U.S. each year.

TITLE: Zelenskyy urges Cannes filmmakers not to be silent
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy gave an impassioned speech via video at the Cannes film festival. He asked them to emulate Charlie Chaplin's <em>The Great Dictator

TITLE: Amber Heard is cross-examined about fights with Johnny Depp
SUMMARY: Johnny Depp's lawyers question the truthfulness of Amber Heard's accusation that Depp sexually assaulted her with a liquor bottle.

TITLE: NPR's Petra Mayer receives posthumous science fiction award
SUMMARY: NPR Books Editor Petra Mayer posthumously receives the Kate Wilhelm Solstice Award from the Science Fiction and Fantasy Writers of America.

TITLE: Buffalo's poet laureate calls for change
SUMMARY: Jillian Hanesworth says what her city needs right now is honest conversations about systemic racism, the history of segregation, redlining and highway construction that hurt Black neighborhoods.

TITLE: Netflix lays off 150 employees amid subscriber decline
SUMMARY: The layoffs are the latest signal of a major shift within the streaming giant as it recently reported a decline in subscribers for the first time in a decade, as well as slowing revenue growth.

TITLE: Budd will face off against Beasley in North Carolina Senate race, per AP race calls
SUMMARY: Rep. Ted Budd, who has former President Donald Trump's endorsement, easily won the North Carolina GOP Senate primary, the AP reports. He will face Democrat Cheri Beasley in November.

TITLE: Pennsylvania Lt. Gov. John Fetterman wins Democratic Senate primary, the AP says
SUMMARY: Pennsylvania has an open Senate seat for the first time in 12 years. Fetterman's Republican opponent was not yet decided. The GOP primary was close going into Tuesday, with three front-runners.

TITLE: Budd will face off against Beasley in North Carolina Senate contest, per AP race calls
SUMMARY: Rep. Ted Budd, who has former President Donald Trump's endorsement, easily won the North Carolina GOP Senate primary, the AP reports. He will face Democrat Cheri Beasley in November.

TITLE: Scandal-plagued Rep. Madison Cawthorn is ousted in North Carolina primary
SUMMARY: The Republican narrowly lost to state Sen. Chuck Edwards, who had received the backing of some Republicans who had tired of Cawthorn's controversies.

TITLE: U.S. officials seek clarity on Turkey's view of NATO expansion
SUMMARY: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken will meet his Turkish counterpart on Wednesday amid  the contradictory signals from Ankara over the expected applications from Finland and Sweden.

TITLE: For businesses in Manhattan's Chinatown, inflation is a tough economic hurdle
SUMMARY: Many businesses have relied on high sales volume to make a profit, but higher costs for wholesale goods and dwindling inventory because of supply chain disruptions are forcing them to raise prices.

TITLE: Finland and Sweden formally submit NATO membership applications
SUMMARY: The 30 member countries of the military alliance are expected to take up to two weeks to evaluate the applications.

TITLE: Fetterman wins Pennsylvania Democratic Senate primary, GOP race is too close to call
SUMMARY: Pennsylvania has an open Senate seat for the first time in 12 years. While the Democratic race was easily decided, the Republican primary looked like it's headed for a recount.

TITLE: Tina Kotek's win comes amid a wave of LGBTQ candidates running for office
SUMMARY: Kotek won her state's Democratic primary on Tuesday. If she wins the general election later this year, she will become the country's first openly lesbian governor.

TITLE: The Buffalo community honors victims of the Tops shooting and calls for big change
SUMMARY: Members of the Buffalo community grieving loved ones organized an evening vigil that honored the shooting victims while combining stirring gospel music and calls to action.

TITLE: How the war in Ukraine 'changed everything' for a generation of young Poles
SUMMARY: Lilia Nguyen's perception of everything around her changed when she went to the border to help Ukrainian refugees shortly after the war began. The change has been felt by other young Poles.

TITLE: For two years, this Washington island has grappled with the long reach of COVID
SUMMARY: The virus hit Whidbey Island early in 2020, and photojournalist Lynn Johnson was there. A million deaths later, we return to see how the pandemic has subtly but indelibly altered life there forever.

TITLE: Parts of the Buffalo shooter's alleged screed were copied from other sources
SUMMARY: The 180-page document allegedly crafted by the Buffalo gunman included parts lifted from other sources, which experts say is common amongst mass shooters.

TITLE: A lawmaker returned home to Ukraine's south and formed his own reconnaissance team
SUMMARY: Col. Roman Kostenko, a Ukrainian lawmaker, has built a reconnaissance and sabotage team to target Russian forces. His ultimate goal: free his family village from Russian control.

TITLE: Why Afghanistan's forces fell immediately after the U.S. left
SUMMARY: Morale across Afghanistan's military was "destroyed" when then-President Trump made a deal with the Taliban in 2020 and President Biden affirmed the U.S. exit in 2021, a new watchdog report says.

TITLE: The U.S. men's and women's soccer teams will be paid equally under a new deal
SUMMARY: The new collective bargaining agreements will run through 2028 and will also include the "equalization" of World Cup prize money, the organization announced.

TITLE: A former Minneapolis cop pleads guilty to manslaughter in George Floyd killing
SUMMARY: Thomas Lane pleaded guilty to a state charge of aiding and abetting second-degree manslaughter in George Floyd's killing. The state is recommending a sentence of three years in prison.

TITLE: Black shelter animals weren't getting adopted. A photographer had an idea: glam shots
SUMMARY: Maggie Epling heard that black cats and dogs often struggle to get adopted. In a push to fix that, she is taking glamour shots of these dark coated beauties at an animal shelter in Pike, Kentucky.

TITLE: The U.S. deal with the Taliban destroyed Afghans' military morale, a new report says
SUMMARY: Morale across Afghanistan's military was "destroyed" when then-President Trump made a deal with the Taliban in 2020 and President Biden affirmed the U.S. exit in 2021, a new watchdog report says.

TITLE: Drought and soaring food prices from Ukraine war leave millions in Africa starving
SUMMARY: A report finds 23 million people are experiencing extreme hunger in Ethiopia, Somalia and Kenya, which face their worst drought in 40 years. Food prices hit record highs after Russia attacked Ukraine.

TITLE: Remembering Urvashi Vaid, an LGBTQ activist who spent decades fighting for equality
SUMMARY: Colleagues, friends and admirers are paying tribute to Vaid, the pioneering attorney and organizer who died at age 63 on Friday. She worked for the ACLU and National LGBTQ Task Force, among others.

TITLE: Fighting the horror of wartime rape, Nobel Prize Peace winner won't give up hope
SUMMARY: Dr. Denis Mukwege has spent decades treating women who have been raped in his homeland of the Democratic Republic of Congo. He's calling on the world to take action for women in Ukraine.

TITLE: Biography examines how systemic racism shaped the troubled life of George Floyd
SUMMARY: Floyd was murdered by a police officer in Minneapolis in 2020. Washington Post reporters Robert Samuels and Toluse Olorunnipa reconstruct the course of his life in His Name is George Floyd.

TITLE: With a key race too close to call, here are 4 takeaways from Tuesday's primaries
SUMMARY: The five statewide primaries once again tested former President Donald Trump's influence on the Republican side — with mixed results. Here's what we learned on Tuesday.

TITLE: In a war crimes trial, a Russian soldier pleads guilty to killing a Ukrainian civilian
SUMMARY: Sgt. Vadim Shishimarin, 21, is facing the first war crimes trial since Russia invaded Ukraine. The Russian soldier could get life in prison for shooting a 62-year-old unarmed civilian in the head.

TITLE: The White House has a stellar record collection, but it needs updating
SUMMARY: John Chuldenko, a grandson of former President Jimmy Carter, is shining a light on the White House record collection, which is outdated. The last records were added in 1980.

TITLE: A member of Ukraine's parliament now trains a recon and sabotage unit to fight Russia
SUMMARY: Col. Roman Kostenko, a Ukrainian lawmaker, has built a reconnaissance and sabotage team to target Russian forces. His ultimate goal: free his family village from Russian control.

TITLE: The Ringling Bros. circus is coming back, with human acts in the center ring
SUMMARY: The circus will launch a U.S. tour of live shows in September 2023.

TITLE: Stocks slump again. This time, it's retailers such as Target spooking investors
SUMMARY: The Dow fell by more than 1,000 points as retailers' earnings reports reflected difficulty navigating higher prices and supply chain bottlenecks.

TITLE: Eric Clapton cancels shows after testing positive for COVID-19
SUMMARY: The 77-year-old guitar legend has been a critic of coronavirus vaccines and pandemic restrictions. He has tested positive for COVID-19 and canceled two upcoming European gigs.

TITLE: Fighting the horror of wartime rape, Nobel Peace Prize winner won't give up hope
SUMMARY: Dr. Denis Mukwege has spent decades treating women who have been raped in his homeland of the Democratic Republic of Congo. He's calling on the world to take action for women in Ukraine.

TITLE: A new federal law bans baby sleep products linked to nearly 200 infant deaths
SUMMARY: President Biden signed the Safe Sleep for Babies Act of 2021 on Monday, outlawing the manufacture and sale of crib bumpers and certain inclined infant sleepers.

TITLE: DHS pauses a board created to combat disinformation amid a campaign to discredit it
SUMMARY: The Department of Homeland Security said Wednesday it would pause the work of a board created to combat disinformation. The board — and its leader — faced an online campaign to discredit its work.

TITLE: Russia-Ukraine war: What happened today (May 18)
SUMMARY: A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: Rare monkeypox outbreak in U.K., Europe and U.S.: What is it and should we worry?
SUMMARY: The cases point to possible sexual transmission of this cousin of smallpox — a previously unknown method of spread for monkeypox.

TITLE: Mariupol has fallen to Russia. Here's what that means for Ukraine
SUMMARY: After months of fighting and shelling, Ukraine has ended its combat mission in Mariupol, and its remaining soldiers have been evacuated to Russian-held territory.

TITLE: New York attorney general launches probe of Twitch and Discord after Buffalo shooting
SUMMARY: The investigation targets online platforms including video-streaming site Twitch, messaging platform Discord and the anonymous message board 4chan.

TITLE: Grubhub offered free lunches in New York City. That's when the chaos began
SUMMARY: Yesterday was a bad day for Grubhub. The food delivery service launched a free lunch promotion for people in New York City. And spoiler alert: it backfired.

TITLE: Biden invokes the Defense Production Act for the baby formula shortage
SUMMARY: Biden is also authorizing the Defense Department to use commercial aircraft to fly formula supplies that meet federal standards from overseas to the U.S.

TITLE: Happy is an Asian elephant. But can she also be considered a person?
SUMMARY: Through an attorney, the Bronx Zoo argues Happy is neither illegally imprisoned nor a person, but a well-cared-for elephant "respected as the magnificent creature she is."

TITLE: Days after Buffalo mass shooting, the House approves a bill to fight domestic terror
SUMMARY: The bill creates offices at DOJ, DHS, and the FBI to track domestic terror threats. GOP lawmakers argue it could allow federal officials to ensnare parents, a charge DOJ rejects.

TITLE: Shanghai is expected to reopen some subways as it eases COVID restrictions
SUMMARY: The lockdown of China's largest city has dealt a blow to the economy and frustrated residents.

TITLE: A photo of Florida students spelling out a racial slur is under investigation
SUMMARY: In the photo, each of the six students is shown holding up a large letter that spells out the N-word.

TITLE: Before a Fiji court: Can the U.S. seize a Russian yacht in the South Pacific?
SUMMARY: The case of a yacht detained in the South Pacific island nation is raising questions about how far U.S. jurisdiction extends.

TITLE: U.S. adviser tries to talk Mexican president out of skipping Summit of the Americas
SUMMARY: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador threatened to skip this year's summit in the United States if Cuba, Venezuela and Nicaragua are excluded.

TITLE: How the war in Ukraine is challenging the long-sought pivot to Asia
SUMMARY: President Biden is traveling to Japan and South Korea this week — his first trip to Asia since taking office. Like presidents before him, he's seeking to reorient U.S. foreign policy toward Asia.

TITLE: A slavery-era instrument is on the National Mall, singing 'songs of liberation'
SUMMARY: An old-fashioned steam calliope designed by luminaries in the worlds of art and jazz is on display at the National Sculpture Garden.

TITLE: Here's what we know about North Korea's COVID outbreak — and its ability to handle it
SUMMARY: North Korea says it's experiencing its first COVID outbreak. Experts are skeptical, but they are also wondering if this means the country will accept outside help or if it can handle it alone.

TITLE: Some clinics are bracing for a huge influx of patients if Roe v. Wade is overturned
SUMMARY: If abortion bans are enacted, millions would be forced to travel to less restrictive states, and some health providers are warning they may not be able to handle the surge in demand.

TITLE: Poll: Two-thirds say don't overturn Roe; the court leak is firing up Democratic voters
SUMMARY: Seven-in-10 U.S. adults say they support some restrictions on abortions, and Americans are split on 15-week bans and whether abortion-inducing medication should be allowed to be mailed to homes.

TITLE: How the U.S. got into this baby formula mess
SUMMARY: Just a handful of formula makers dominate the industry so a single plant shutdown can lead to empty shelves.

TITLE: They escaped the war in Ukraine. Then they faced fresh trouble in Poland
SUMMARY: Millions of people have fled Ukraine since the war started, but not all are Ukrainian. And some citizens of African countries have found that the doors of Europe are much less open to them.

TITLE: Pro-Trump counties continue to suffer far higher COVID death tolls
SUMMARY: As Americans commemorate a million deaths due to COVID-19, the partisan divide of who has gotten sick and died continues to grow, mostly due to disinformation about the vaccines.

TITLE: The Buffalo shooting shuttered Tops and left a food desert. Locals are stepping in.
SUMMARY: Local organizations are behind food distributions in the East Side of Buffalo following the shooting at a Tops supermarket.

TITLE: Former President George W. Bush condemns Putin's invasion of Iraq — instead of Ukraine
SUMMARY: In a speech, Bush criticized "the decision of one man to launch a wholly unjustified and brutal invasion of Iraq — I mean of Ukraine."

TITLE: Kharkiv's mayor says it's time to move out of the city's subway stations
SUMMARY: As Ukrainian troops push Russian forces away from its second-largest city, the mayor urges thousands of residents to emerge from their makeshift shelters in the city's metro stations and trains.

TITLE: The Buffalo grocery store shooting suspect appears in court today
SUMMARY: The hearing will determine if there's enough evidence against Payton Gendron, the man accused of killing 10 people in a racially motivated shooting rampage in Buffalo, N.Y., to proceed to trial.

TITLE: Trying to condemn the war in Ukraine, Bush inadvertently calls Iraq war unjustified
SUMMARY: In a speech, Bush criticized "the decision of one man to launch a wholly unjustified and brutal invasion of Iraq — I mean of Ukraine."

TITLE: Nearly 270 cases of salmonella have been linked to chocolate Easter eggs
SUMMARY: European health officials say that 266 confirmed cases and 58 suspected cases of an outbreak have been reported throughout Europe and in North America. The vast majority of the cases are in children.

TITLE: 'Pharma Bro' Martin Shkreli has been released from prison
SUMMARY: Shkreli, a former pharmaceutical executive known for raising the price of a life-saving drug by 5,000%, was sentenced to seven years in prison in for securities fraud in 2018.

TITLE: These 14 states had significant miscounts in the 2020 census
SUMMARY: The states were not counted equally well for population totals used to determine their share of political representation and federal funding for the next 10 years, a new Census Bureau report shows.

TITLE: Buffalo prosecutors get more time to build their case against a mass shooting suspect
SUMMARY: Payton Gendron is accused in a racist supermarket attack that killed 10 people. On Thursday, a judge delayed the hearing that will decide if there's enough evidence to proceed to trial until June 9.

TITLE: Courtroom drama: Ukrainian widow confronts Russian who shot her husband
SUMMARY: The widow asked the Russian soldier what he felt when he killed her husband. "Fear," he said. "I understand you probably won't be able to forgive me. But I ask for your forgiveness."

TITLE: A man's death shows the dangers of digging deep holes on the beach
SUMMARY: A town on the Outer Banks issued a public plea to beachgoers about the dangers of digging holes on the oceanfront just hours before a man died at a New Jersey beach when a hole collapsed on him.

TITLE: More than 90,000 hoverboards sold in the U.S. are being recalled over safety concerns
SUMMARY: A software glitch can send power to the device's motor even when the rider is not actively engaging the hoverboard.

TITLE: A divide between the pulpit and the pew is roiling the evangelical church
SUMMARY: <em>New York Times

TITLE: Twitter aims to crack down on misinformation, including misleading posts about Ukraine
SUMMARY: Twitter is stepping up its fight against misinformation with a new policy cracking down on posts that spread potentially dangerous false stories.

TITLE: The CDC is investigating 180 cases of children with hepatitis. The cause is a mystery
SUMMARY: The count of pediatric cases under investigation has grown since the agency's last update, but most of the increase represents previous cases that are just now being reported.

TITLE: Vangelis, famed film composer and synth pioneer, dead at 79
SUMMARY: Vangelis composed the music for Blade Runner and Chariots of Fire

TITLE: Biden backs Sweden and Finland's NATO membership application
SUMMARY: Biden said Thursday he was sending paperwork to Congress to ratify Finland and Sweden's application to join NATO. The ratification process is expected to pass with bipartisan support.

TITLE: FDA head says baby formula factory could reopen in the next week or two
SUMMARY: But Abbott has said that, after production resumes, it could take about two months before new formula begins arriving in stores. The company's factory has been closed due to contamination problems.

TITLE: After the Buffalo slayings, parents struggle through talks with their children
SUMMARY: Some of the children want to know how someone could do something so horrible. Others are too young to fully comprehend. Parents say there are no easy answers to the questions the children ask.

TITLE: Oklahoma's legislature passes a bill banning nearly all abortions
SUMMARY: If Gov. Kevin Stitt signs the bill, the legislation would go into effect immediately.

TITLE: Johnny Depp's former business manager and others chart the actor's rise and fall
SUMMARY: Testifying at the behest of attorneys representing Depp's ex-wife Amber Heard were a longtime agent, a former business manager and a friend of Depp's for nearly four decades.

TITLE: Russia-Ukraine war: What happened today (May 19)
SUMMARY: A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: CDC advisers urge Pfizer booster for children ages 5 to 11
SUMMARY: If the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention agrees, as expected, it would open a third COVID-19 shot to healthy elementary-age kids.

TITLE: A former deputy gets 18 years after 2 women drowned in a locked police van
SUMMARY: A police van in South Carolina was swept away by floodwaters in the aftermath of Hurricane Florence, drowning two women who were trapped in a cage in the back.

TITLE: Here's why tech giants want the Supreme Court to freeze Texas' social media law
SUMMARY: Tech industry groups are urging the Supreme Court to block a Texas law barring social media companies from removing posts or banning users based on political viewpoints

TITLE: Bird-watcher wrongfully accused in Central Park video gets a bird-watching TV show
SUMMARY: In the series, Christian Cooper will take viewers into the "wild, wonderful and unpredictable world of birds," according to National Geographic.

TITLE: Georgia NAACP is investigating a traffic stop involving a college lacrosse team
SUMMARY: Delaware State University filed a complaint Wednesday to the Justice Department's Civil Rights Division calling for an external investigation of the traffic stop.

TITLE: Canada bans China's Huawei Technologies from 5G networks
SUMMARY: Wireless carriers in Canada have been banned from installing Huawei equipment in their high-speed 5G networks, as the country joined allies in banning the giant Chinese technology company.

TITLE: Sri Lanka closes schools and limits work to combat fuel shortage
SUMMARY: Sri Lankan authorities closed schools and asked public officials not to come to work in a desperate move to prepare for an acute fuel shortage during the nation's worst economic crisis in decades.

TITLE: Where is 'Harry's House' anyway? Harry Styles explains
SUMMARY: The pop star has spent a life on the go, so the pandemic offered him a rare chance for reflection, to separate the person from the pop star. Also, of course, to record a new album.

TITLE: Much of the U.S. could criminalize abortion. But how will those laws be enforced?
SUMMARY: Law professor Kim Mutcherson said that while states are bound by HIPAA laws, individuals are not. This means that abortion "bounty hunters" could help punish people who seek abortions in other states.

TITLE: Millions rushed to leave Ukraine. Now the queue to return home stretches for miles
SUMMARY: If you want to get into Ukraine by vehicle, you might have to wait hours at the Medyka border, where people sit in a line of cars that stretches for miles and takes hours to move.

TITLE: How Rahima came to hold a special place in smallpox history — and help ensure its end
SUMMARY: Scientists went to extraordinary lengths to eradicate smallpox from the world. Rahima Banu is now recorded as having the last known naturally-occurring case of the deadly form.

TITLE: New Mexico wildfire sparks backlash against controlled burns. That's bad for the West
SUMMARY: Experts worry a devastating wildfire in New Mexico, partly started by a controlled burn that got out of control, may create a backlash against this important forest management tool.

TITLE: Body armor, worn by the Buffalo shooter, faces far fewer regulations than guns
SUMMARY: A security guard at the Tops market tried to fire back at the shooter, but his fire struck body armor instead. Experts say use of body armor by mass shooters has trended up in recent years.

TITLE: Telehealth abortions are simple and private — but restricted in many states
SUMMARY: Recent rule changes made it easier for patients to get abortion pills through the mail, using telehealth services. Now there is growing demand for these services – and new legal battles brewing.

TITLE: A shooting in Chicago leaves 2 people dead and 8 wounded
SUMMARY: The shooting happened about late Thursday a few blocks from the city's Magnificent Mile shopping district. One person was taken into custody and a weapon was recovered, police said in statement.

TITLE: A delivery robot creates a poetic moment in the woods of England
SUMMARY: Matthew McCormack, a history professor in Northampton, U.K., encountered something unexpected while cycling in the woods: a wandering delivery robot.

TITLE: Russia aims to capitalize on controlling the Ukrainian port city of Mariupol
SUMMARY: More than a thousand soldiers were evacuated from the Azovstal steel plant, and Russia is consolidating control of Mariupol. It is making plans to annex the southwestern parts of the country.

TITLE: Elon Musk denies a report accusing him of sexual misconduct on a SpaceX jet
SUMMARY: The SpaceX CEO disputes a report alleging that his company settled a sexual misconduct claim for $250,000, after he exposed himself and propositioned a flight attendant.

TITLE: The Buffalo shooting suspect's online footprint prompts questions about red flags
SUMMARY: A digital log believed to be linked to the accused Buffalo gunman documents six months of planning the terrorist attack. Researchers are looking through it and asking: Were there any red flags?

TITLE: Ford is recalling about 39,000 SUVS after 16 catch fire under the hood
SUMMARY: The company is urging those with affected vehicles to park their cars outside and away from structures.

TITLE: 'Elon Musk's Crash Course' shows the tragic cost of his leadership
SUMMARY: A <em>New York Times/

TITLE: Philippine Supreme Court petition seeks to cancel candidacy of President-elect Marcos
SUMMARY: The petition, filed Tuesday, seeks to disqualify Ferdinand Marcos Jr.'s candidacy post-election on the grounds that he lied about not committing any crimes — a requirement to run for president.

TITLE: Two versions of history collide as Finland and Sweden seek to join NATO
SUMMARY: Finland and Sweden have long kept a careful balance — and neutral position — between the West and Russia. But that changed after Moscow invaded Ukraine.

TITLE: Art values are booming as New York auctions make billions of dollars in sales
SUMMARY: Sotheby's, Christie's and Phillips total sales have hit more than $2.5 billion for 2022 already, led by works by Andy Warhol, Jean-Michel Basquiat and Pablo Picasso.

TITLE: The Taliban say Afghan female TV anchors must cover their faces on air
SUMMARY: The order came from the Taliban's Virtue and Vice Ministry as well as from the Information and Culture Ministry. Earlier this month, the Taliban ordered women in public to wear head-to-toe clothing.

TITLE: Stocks entered a bear market. Here's what that means
SUMMARY: The S&P 500, one of the broadest stock market indexes, entered a bear market during Friday's trading. That means it had fallen a stunning 20% from a recent high in January.

SUMMARY: Decades ago, Jonathan Searle played one of the pranksters with a cardboard fin in <em>Jaws

TITLE: Russia-Ukraine war: What happened today (May 20)
SUMMARY: A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: Scientists discover an ancient forest inside a giant sinkhole in China
SUMMARY: The sinkhole spans an area nearly three football fields long and is deep enough to hide the Washington Monument. Explorers descended into the pit, where they found ancient trees and other plant life.

TITLE: LA removes crosswalks allegedly painted by a secretive group
SUMMARY: A series of DIY crosswalks are being replaced in Hollywood. City officials say they're clearing the way for a better and safer intersection.

TITLE: Judge rules that pandemic border restrictions must continue, a win for GOP-led states
SUMMARY: A federal judge in Louisiana has blocked the Biden administration from lifting the pandemic border restrictions known as Title 42, which were set to end on Monday.

TITLE: US forest chief calls for a pause on prescribed fire operations
SUMMARY: The U.S. Forest Service has been facing much criticism for the prescribed fire in New Mexico that escaped its containment lines and joined with another blaze.

TITLE: Longtime New Yorker writer, editor Roger Angell has died
SUMMARY: Writer Roger Angell died Friday of heart failure, according to The New Yorker.

TITLE: Coronavirus FAQ: I took Paxlovid. I felt better. Then symptoms rebounded. What's up?
SUMMARY: The antiviral drug is prescribed to those at risk of severe disease. It's been credited with reducing hospitalizations. But then there's the "Paxlovid rebound."

TITLE: A 911 dispatcher may be fired for allegedly mishandling a Buffalo shooting call
SUMMARY: A grocery worker whispered into her phone during a 911 call so she wouldn't draw the shooter's attention. She says the dispatcher yelled at her for whispering. The two ended up disconnected.

TITLE: The outcome of the Pennsylvania GOP Senate primary might not be known before June

TITLE: Eva, the hero dog, beats back a mountain lion that attacked her owner on a hike
SUMMARY: Erin Wilson recounts how her dog saved her from a mountain lion attack while she hiked along a river in remote Northern California. Eva the Belgian Malinois is recovering.

TITLE: She joined DHS to fight disinformation. She says she was halted by... disinformation
SUMMARY: Nina Jankowicz looks back at how exaggerations and falsehoods stoked so many doubts about the Disinformation Governance Board that DHS paused it after just three weeks.

TITLE: Trump's MAGA is marching down a trail blazed by the Tea Party
SUMMARY: The populist energy within the Republican Party goes by the name the former president gave it: MAGA. And its influence on the 2022 midterms seems destined to track that of the Tea Party surge in 2010.

TITLE: Should 18-year-olds be allowed to buy semi-automatic rifles? State and courts debate
SUMMARY: Efforts by states to to raise the minimum age for buying a long rifle have been challenged in court by gun rights activists.

TITLE: Roma refugees who fled from Ukraine to Moldova are now in limbo

SUMMARY: The Labor Party appeared more likely than Prime Minister Scott Morrison's coalition to form a government after Australia's election on Saturday that could result in a rare hung parliament.

TITLE: How a Ukrainian teacher helped students escape Russia's invasion, and still graduate
SUMMARY: As residents return to a liberated town near Kyiv, a teacher and her high school students recount what it took to survive the war.

TITLE: Archbishop says Pelosi will be denied Communion because she supports abortion rights
SUMMARY: Archbishop Salvatore Cordileone of San Francisco said he sent House Speaker Nancy Pelosi a letter expressing his concerns after she vowed to codify the Supreme Court's <em>Roe v. Wade

SUMMARY: The German Weather Service confirmed three tornadoes in North Rhine-Westphalia — in Paderborn, in nearby Lippstadt, and on the edge of the town of Hoexter.

TITLE: Boeing finally docks a capsule to the space station

TITLE: Australia's prime minister concedes despite millions of votes left to be counted
SUMMARY: The Labor Party appeared more likely than Prime Minister Scott Morrison's coalition to form a government after Australia's election on Saturday that could result in a rare hung parliament.

TITLE: At least 2 people were killed in a rare tornado that hit northern Michigan
SUMMARY: The tornado that struck the town of Gaylord also left more than 40 people injured. The governor has declared a state of emergency.

SUMMARY: The 46-year-old heads into a rainy Saturday round at his second major golf event since suffering a leg injury in a car accident.

SUMMARY: The Tops Friendly Markets grocery store opened on Jefferson Avenue on the East Side of Buffalo in 2003. It was a long road to get there.

SUMMARY: It's been a difficult and emotional week in Buffalo, N.Y., following last week's shootings at a local supermarket. The racist attack has jarred the community as the first funerals begin.

TITLE: A surge in Navy deserters could be a sign of a bigger problem for the military

TITLE: Archbishop bars Pelosi from Communion over her support for abortion rights
SUMMARY: Archbishop Salvatore Cordileone of San Francisco said he sent House Speaker Nancy Pelosi a letter expressing his concerns after she vowed to codify the Supreme Court's <em>Roe v. Wade

TITLE: The youngest of the 10 Buffalo shooting victims was laid to rest
SUMMARY: Roberta Drury grew up in the Syracuse area and moved to Buffalo a decade ago to help tend to her brother in his fight against leukemia. She was remembered for her love for family and friends.

TITLE: An archbishop bars Pelosi from Communion over her support for abortion rights
SUMMARY: Archbishop Salvatore Cordileone of San Francisco said he sent House Speaker Nancy Pelosi a letter expressing his concerns after she vowed to codify the Supreme Court's <em>Roe v. Wade

TITLE: Jif peanut butter is being recalled for potential salmonella contamination
SUMMARY: The J.M. Smucker Co. announced the recall on Friday. The Food and Drug Administration says current epidemiologic evidence points to a Lexington, Ky., facility as the likely cause of the outbreak.

TITLE: Early Voting wins the Preakness Stakes
SUMMARY: Early Voting won the 2022 Preakness Stakes, outracing Epicenter and Creative Minister. Early Voting came into the race as one of the top contenders to win.

SUMMARY: Roberta Drury grew up in the Syracuse area and moved to Buffalo a decade ago to help tend to her brother in his fight against leukemia. She was remembered for her love for family and friends.

SUMMARY: The tornado that struck the town of Gaylord also left more than 40 people injured. The governor has declared a state of emergency.

SUMMARY: It marked the first time Woods has withdrawn from a major golf championship in his professional career.

SUMMARY: Kate McKinnon and Pete Davidson are among those departing from "Saturday Night Live," leaving the sketch institution without arguably its two most famous names after Saturday's 47th season finale.

SUMMARY: Australians awoke on Sunday to a new prime minister in Anthony Albanese, the center-left Labor Party leader, though it remains unclear whether his party can form a majority government.

SUMMARY: With Russia claiming to have taken prisoner nearly 2,500 Ukrainian fighters from the besieged Mariupol steel plant, concerns grew about their fate.

SUMMARY: One man was killed and eight people were wounded during an overnight shooting at a party that drew about 100 people to a Southern California hookah lounge.

SUMMARY: TikTok has flipped the script on the music industry, and everyone from artists to analysts and even marketing bosses at the top labels are trying to catch up.

SUMMARY: Ruether was among the first scholars to think deeply about the role of women in Christianity, shaking up old patriarchies and pushing for change.

SUMMARY: Kate McKinnon, Pete Davidson, Aidy Bryant and Kyle Mooney are departing from <em>Saturday Night Live

SUMMARY: A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

SUMMARY: Leaders of the Southern Baptist Convention stonewalled and denigrated survivors of clergy sex abuse over almost two decades, according to an independent report.

TITLE: Large swaths of the U.S. set daily temperature records
SUMMARY: Many cities throughout the country, including in Massachusetts and Virginia, set new daily heat records on Saturday and Sunday.

SUMMARY: The actor speaks with NPR's Michel Martin about BlueCheck Ukraine, an aid network he co-founded, as well as his relationship with his grandfather.

SUMMARY: The isolated East Asian country has only stated how many people have fevers daily, and has only identified a few of the cases as COVID-19 since admitting to an outbreak of the omicron variant.

SUMMARY: A White House official said Biden's comments did not reflect a policy shift, even though the U.S. traditionally has avoided making such an explicit security guarantee to Taiwan.

SUMMARY: Musician John Legend is using his national platform to elevate local races for district attorney — endorsing progressive prosecutors who prioritize preventative solutions over incarceration.

SUMMARY: Advocates of the proposal say it would prevent overdoses, slow the spread of HIV and inspire drug users to seek help, while proponents say safe injection sites would create an "open drug scene."

SUMMARY: For decades, U.S. astronauts and Russian cosmonauts have lived side-by-side aboard the International Space Station. Now some are wondering whether that partnership can withstand the war in Ukraine.

SUMMARY: Redrawn congressional maps pit two Democratic incumbents against each other in the Atlanta suburbs.

SUMMARY: Violence and natural disasters are fueling the surge in the number of people displaced, the U.N. says in a new report.

SUMMARY: Vadim Shishimarin, 21, had pleaded guilty last week to shooting an unarmed Ukrainian man in late February. On Monday, a panel of judges in Kyiv sentenced him to life in prison.

SUMMARY: Pfizer plans to submit the new data to the Food and Drug Administration this week, bringing families with young children one step closer to a long-awaited vaccine.

SUMMARY: A White House official said Biden's comments did not reflect a policy shift, even though the U.S. traditionally has avoided making such an explicit security guarantee to Taiwan.

SUMMARY: The coffee chain joins McDonald's in taking its brand out of the country. Starbucks had temporarily paused operations in March.

SUMMARY: Pfizer plans to submit new data to the Food and Drug Administration this week, bringing families with young children one step closer to a long-awaited vaccine.

SUMMARY: Sacramento police had to cut Saturday's event short because of the "overwhelming response." Meanwhile, a buyback event in Brooklyn gave iPads to people who dropped off certain types of firearms.

SUMMARY: The suspect, Kaitlin Marie Armstrong, and Wilson had both had a relationship with the same man, according to an arrest warrant.

SUMMARY: Buffalo consistently ranks as one of the most segregated cities in the nation.

SUMMARY: The suspect, Kaitlin Marie Armstrong, and Wilson had both had a relationship with the same man, according to an arrest warrant.

SUMMARY: Just last week, a Ukrainian court seized hundreds of millions of dollars' worth of assets owned by a Russian oligarch.

SUMMARY: The first-term congressman, who lost his reelection bid in last week's primary, is accused of promoting a cryptocurrency he had a financial interest in and an "improper relationship" with a staffer.

SUMMARY: The Supreme Court is expected to strike down <em>Roe v. Wade

SUMMARY: Fears of a global food crisis are growing because of the shock of the war in Ukraine, climate change and rising inflation.

SUMMARY: Colin Cantwell worked on other films including 2001: A Space Odyssey and WarGames

SUMMARY: A subset of staff at the massive video game company Activision Blizzard voted to join the Communication Workers of America. The vote comes as Activision Blizzard is being purchased by Microsoft.

TITLE: Hot weather could be getting in the way of good sleep, a new study finds

SUMMARY: Organizers say proceeds from the auction will be donated to PEN, which advocates for free expression around the world.

SUMMARY: Fears of a global food crisis are growing because of the shock of the war in Ukraine, climate change and rising inflation.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from Georgia
SUMMARY: In Georgia, there are notable primaries for governor, Senate and key congressional districts.

TITLE: The election system shuddered in 2020. Now, there are fears of an attack within
SUMMARY: The election system shuddered in 2020 as Donald Trump sough to overturn the result. Now, election deniers and defenders have eyes on the nuts and bolts of the process itself.

TITLE: A school seeks to dismiss a lawsuit filed by Michelle Obama's brother and his wife
SUMMARY: The school argues it exercised its contractual right to deny the Robinson children enrollment in 2021, as school officials determined it was in the "best interest of the school."

TITLE: A new clinic offering abortions is set to open in Wyoming, despite a looming ban
SUMMARY: Aimed at serving a regional "abortion desert," the clinic plans   to open, despite the expected overturn of <em>Roe v. Wade

TITLE: 9 primary races to watch Tuesday in Georgia, Texas, Alabama and Arkansas
SUMMARY: Georgia holds the political spotlight, as primary races take place in southern states this Tuesday. Here are nine contests we're keeping an eye on.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from Alabama
SUMMARY: Voting concludes Tuesday in the Alabama primary elections. Notable primaries include governor, U.S. Senate and House district races.

TITLE: Here are the key primary election results from Arkansas
SUMMARY: Voting concludes Tuesday in the Arkansas primary elections, where Sarah Huckabee Sanders is running for governor to replace incumbent and term-limited Gov. Asa Hutchinson.

TITLE: A battlefield assessment — three months after Russia invaded Ukraine
SUMMARY: When Ukraine was invaded, many expected a quick Russian victory. The war is three months old, with both sides digging in and no end in sight. Many analysts say the trends now favor Ukraine.

TITLE: DOJ's new policy requires officers to stop others from using excessive force
SUMMARY: The policy spells out situations in which officers have an "affirmative duty" — to prevent or stop other officers from using excessive force, and to render or call for medical aid when it's needed.

TITLE: Big Brothers Big Sisters receives a $122.6 million donation to mentor kids
SUMMARY: Billionaire philanthropist MacKenzie Scott continues her charity drive with a $122.6 million donation to Big Brothers Big Sisters of America, the group's largest gift ever from an individual.

TITLE: Three months of war: Russia underachieves, Ukraine overachieves
SUMMARY: When Ukraine was invaded, many expected a quick Russian victory. The war is 3 months old, with both sides digging in for a battle that could potentially be a long, drawn-out stalemate.

TITLE: Steelers quarterback Dwayne Haskins was legally drunk when he was fatally struck
SUMMARY: The 24-year-old athlete had also taken drugs before he was fatally struck by a dump truck while walking on a Florida interstate highway just before dawn last month, an autopsy report concluded.

TITLE: Last call: New York City bids an official farewell to its last public pay phone
SUMMARY: Officials gathered in Times Square for the removal of what they called New York City's last public pay phone, which is headed to a local museum. But a number of other pay phones are still standing.

TITLE: Hyundai is recalling 239,000 cars for exploding seat belt parts
SUMMARY: Hyundai is recalling 239,000 cars in the U.S. because the seat belt pretensioners can explode and injure vehicle occupants. Three injuries have been reported, two in the U.S. and one in Singapore.

TITLE: A pastor quits over 'adultery,' but a woman says she was 16 when he abused her
SUMMARY: Pastor John Lowe II received a standing ovation after he confessed. But then a woman stepped forward and told him, "You are not the victim here."

TITLE: Male Afghan TV anchors cover faces in solidarity with women after a Taliban order
SUMMARY: Male anchors in Afghanistan are wearing masks on air in solidarity with their female colleagues. This is the latest Taliban order to threaten the freedoms and careers of Afghan women.

TITLE: What's ailing long COVID patients? A new federal study looks for clues
SUMMARY: The first results from an in-depth investigation of long COVID produced provocative results. Researchers don't understand the mechanism behind the lingering symptoms but found a link with anxiety.

TITLE: Several students are injured after a shooting locked down a Texas elementary school
SUMMARY: At least two hospitals were treating patients Tuesday after a shooter prompted a lockdown at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, about 85 miles west of San Antonio.

TITLE: Get ready for another destructive Atlantic hurricane season
SUMMARY: Federal forecasters expect more hurricanes than usual this year. Climate change is driving larger, more destructive storms. This is the seventh year in a row with an above-average forecast.

TITLE: Southern Baptist leaders plan to release a secret list of accused sex abusers
SUMMARY: Leaders of the Southern Baptist Convention said they will release a secret list of hundreds of pastors and other church-affiliated personnel accused of sexual abuse.

TITLE: 27 school shootings have taken place so far this year
SUMMARY: A shooting an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas marks the 27th such school shooting in the U.S. this year.

TITLE: 3 months into the Russia-Ukraine war: What happened today (May 24)
SUMMARY: A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: Monkeypox isn't like COVID-19 — and that's a good thing
SUMMARY: Although monkeypox's recent spread has caused concern, its similarities to smallpox have given the public health world a head start on combating it.

TITLE: This 830-million-year-old crystal might contain life. And we're about to open it
SUMMARY: From lemons to ham, salt is a handy food preservative. But researchers studying some really old salt crystals found them preserving something else — evidence of life.

TITLE: Composer John Williams and cellist Yo-Yo Ma bring together 'A Gathering of Friends'
SUMMARY: On a new album, the classical stars revisit the concerto Williams composed specifically for Ma, as well as some of Williams' most affecting film scores.

TITLE: How schools and the Biden administration are prioritizing student mental health
SUMMARY: Schools and the federal government are trying to provide the kinds of mental health support that many families either can't find, or can't afford.

TITLE: A gunman killed 14 children and a teacher at a Texas elementary school, governor says
SUMMARY: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott told reporters 14 children and one teacher were killed during a school shooting at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, on Tuesday.

TITLE: A gunman killed at least 14 children and a teacher at a Texas elementary school
SUMMARY: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott told reporters 14 children and one teacher were killed during a school shooting at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, on Tuesday.

TITLE: In Uvalde, the hometown of actor Matthew McConaughey, Friday night football rules
SUMMARY: The small town of Uvalde, Texas, is a place where Friday night football rules and its claim to fame is being the hometown of actor Matthew McConaughey.

TITLE: Capitol riot trial of former Army reservist and alleged 'Nazi sympathizer' begins
SUMMARY: Timothy Hale-Cusanelli is the latest defendant to face trial for his alleged role in the Jan. 6, 2021, U.S. Capitol riot. Federal prosecutors say he was intent on inciting a second "civil war."

TITLE: Update on Biden's remarks on the Uvalde, Texas, school shooting
SUMMARY: Ailsa Chang talks with NPR's Tamara Keith and Cory Turner about Biden's comments tonight on the shooting at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas.

TITLE: Trump's pick for governor — who ran on election lies — loses to Kemp in Georgia
SUMMARY: Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp won the GOP primary for governor over former U.S. Sen. David Perdue. Kemp will face Democrat Stacey Abrams in November — a rematch of 2018.

TITLE: Herschel Walker easily wins Georgia's Republican Senate primary
SUMMARY: Walker topped a handful of rivals, according to a race call by The Associated Press. He will face Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock in November.

TITLE: The small town of Uvalde, Texas is reeling from tragedy
SUMMARY: The small town of Uvalde, Texas, is a place where Friday night football rules, and its claim to fame is being the hometown of actor Matthew McConaughey.

TITLE: A gunman killed at least 18 children and 2 adults at a Texas elementary school
SUMMARY: A Texas Department of Public Safety official says the death toll from today's shooting at Robb Elementary School is now 20. The 18-year-old gunman is dead, police said.

TITLE: Biden has a new executive order on policing, 2 years after George Floyd was killed
SUMMARY: The order will be signed Wednesday, the second anniversary of the murder of George Floyd while in police custody. But it only applies to federal law enforcement — not local forces

TITLE: In Arkansas, Sarah Huckabee Sanders sweeps the GOP primary for governor
SUMMARY: Former President Trump endorsed Sarah Huckabee Sanders for Arkansas governor before her campaign began. She handily won Tuesday's primary and is expected to be the state's first woman governor in Nov.

TITLE: Tragedy now overshadows Uvalde, a small town growing in population
SUMMARY: The small town of Uvalde, Texas, is a place where Friday night football rules, and its claim to fame is being the hometown of actor Matthew McConaughey.

TITLE: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton, endorsed by Trump, wins Republican primary
SUMMARY: In a runoff primary election with George P. Bush, Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton pulled off a win. Paxton is embattled in legal issues but easily won over his Republican rival.

SUMMARY: Incumbent Republican Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger famously refused then-President Donald Trump's entreaties to "find" enough votes to overturn his loss in Georgia.

TITLE: Katie Britt and U.S. Rep. Mo Brooks are headed for an Alabama Senate runoff
SUMMARY: Alabama's Republican primary for U.S. Senate is going to a June runoff between Katie Britt and U.S. Rep. Mo Brooks after neither candidate captured a majority of the vote.

TITLE: Incumbent Gov. Kay Ivey wins GOP primary in Alabama
SUMMARY: Up against eight Republican challengers, Gov. Kay Ivey will move forward to the general election for governor in Alabama where a Democrat hasn't been elected to the office for a quarter-century.

TITLE: North Korea launches three missiles into the sea, including suspected ICBM
SUMMARY: North Korea launched three ballistic missiles toward the sea on Wednesday, its neighbors said, hours after President Joe Biden wrapped up his trip to Asia.

TITLE: Sale of sanctioned oligarch's Chelsea Football Club approved by U.K. government
SUMMARY: The government had to be sure that Roman Abramovich, sanctioned over his links to Russian President Vladimir Putin, did not profit from the enforced sale of one of football's most successful clubs.

TITLE: Survivors of Parkland and Columbine shootings share their outrage over Uvalde tragedy
SUMMARY: Both survivors share their criticism of how, even years after shootings at their schools, no changes have been made to address mass gun violence in America.

TITLE: What we know so far about the school shooting in Uvalde, Texas
SUMMARY: The attack Tuesday afternoon at Robb Elementary School took the lives of 21 people.

TITLE: For Heather and Kerry, their tour through a Mormon temple is a bittersweet experience
SUMMARY: For Kerry Pray and her wife, Heather, touring a Latter-day Saint temple is a cathartic, eye-opening and emotional experience.

TITLE: The Buffalo shooting is a reminder that millions don't live near a grocery store
SUMMARY: Grocery stores provide healthy foods, create jobs and offer a place for community connection. "We started calling them front-line and essential workers for a reason," says one food access advocate.

SUMMARY: Walter Delgado was 11 when he and his grandpa began the dangerous journey from El Salvador to the U.S. Along the way, Delgado started to falter, but another traveler carried him across the border.

SUMMARY: The pandemic got more people riding bikes, but the number of cyclists hit and killed by cars is rising at an alarming rate. "We're buying materials for ghost bikes in bulk," one cycling advocate says.

SUMMARY: McConaughey urged people not to accept such tragedies as the status quo.

TITLE: Closely watched Democratic primary in Texas' 28th District remains too close to call
SUMMARY: A runoff in South Texas between incumbent Democratic Rep. Henry Cuellar and progressive challenger Jessica Cisneros remained too close to call as of Wednesday morning.

TITLE: NBA coach Steve Kerr calls out 50 senators on a bipartisan gun background check law

SUMMARY: "It is time to say enough to the indiscriminate trafficking of arms," Pope Francis said on Wednesday, as he sent condolences to families in Uvalde, Texas.

SUMMARY: To combat Russia's larger military, Ukraine has turned to creative tactics, from low-tech to high-tech. You could call them 'war hacks.' And many seem to be working.

TITLE: Shireen Abu Akleh's voice was the soundtrack of my childhood. Her legacy lives on
SUMMARY: As a young Palestinian girl, I copied Abu Akleh's TV sign-off. She was brave and unwavering – a true trailblazer for many other women to follow her path.

SUMMARY: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and other Ukrainian leaders took to social media to stand in sympathy and solidarity with a tragedy unfolding across the world.

SUMMARY: Officials around the world are responding to the school shooting in Uvalde, Texas, the deadliest such incident to take place in the U.S. in nearly a decade.

TITLE: 3 reasons Trump's influence took a big hit in Tuesday's primaries
SUMMARY: You'd be hard-pressed to find two Republican incumbents who drew more of Donald Trump's ire than Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp and Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger. Both won big on Tuesday.

TITLE: War hacks: How outgunned Ukraine finds ways to counter Russia
SUMMARY: To combat Russia's larger military, Ukraine has turned to creative tactics, from low-tech to high-tech. You could call them "war hacks." And many seem to be working.

SUMMARY: Melissa Brymer says talking to kids about school shootings can be upsetting; you may need to have conversations in small chunks for them to understand.

SUMMARY: The shooting at a Tops grocery store, which authorities say was motivated by racist hate, brought into sharper focus the weight of being a target.

SUMMARY: The small community of Uvalde, Texas is grieving one of the deadliest school shootings in U.S. history as assistance — and the national political spotlight – descends on the area.

TITLE: What to say to kids about school shootings to ease their stress

SUMMARY: A large body of research shows being denied an abortion limits women's education, time in the workforce and wages. It also finds long-term negative impacts for their children.

SUMMARY: History has many lessons to offer on how much it will cost to rebuild Ukraine, and how it can be done to help set the country up for a more prosperous and safe future.

TITLE: The Miami Heat urges fans to call their senators about gun law reform
SUMMARY: A moment of silence was held before the announcement, made Wednesday night at a playoff game.

SUMMARY: A father whose fourth-grade daughter was killed in the attack, said he raced to the school and raised the idea of charging into the school with several other bystanders.

SUMMARY: Professor Jon Levy went viral for wearing a mask during a Zoom call alone in his office. He has some thoughts about why.

SUMMARY: Local and state officials in Texas release more information, while Americans across the nation continue to express shock and grief at the massacre.

TITLE: The Jif peanut butter recall is pulling a cascade of other products from store shelves
SUMMARY: Many other companies use the peanut butter — the cause of a salmonella outbreak — and now they have recalls of their own. The FDA says the products made it to at least 10 other countries.

SUMMARY: The weapon used to carry out the mass shooting in Uvalde, Texas, is one all too familiar to Americans and lawmakers who have witnessed mass shootings occur over the past decade.

SUMMARY: The amount of resources devoted to studying gun violence is paltry compared to its public health impact. Still the evidence shows certain policies might help prevent mass shootings.

SUMMARY: NPR wants to know how your children are coping with the tragedy in Uvalde, Texas. Have they drawn a photo or written a letter or poem to express themselves? We'd like to share them with our audience.

TITLE: 'Goodfellas' star Ray Liotta dead at 67
SUMMARY: According to his publicist, the actor died in his sleep in the Dominican Republic, where he was shooting a movie.

TITLE: Trump loses an appeal and must testify in New York's civil investigation
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump must answer questions under oath in New York Attorney General Letitia James' civil investigation into his business practices, a state appeals court ruled Thursday.

TITLE: A lawsuit says a 13-year-old Black boy had his hands up when Chicago police shot him
SUMMARY: The teen, who was shot in the back by a police officer, was unarmed and had his arms raised to surrender, according to a lawsuit. The bullet severely damaged part of the seventh-grader's spine.

SUMMARY: The actor is facing four counts of sexual assault as well as one for "causing a person to engage in penetrative sexual activity without consent," according to prosecutors.

TITLE: The Jif peanut butter recall is pulling a cascade of other products from s shelves
SUMMARY: Many other companies use the peanut butter — the cause of a salmonella outbreak — and now they have recalls of their own. The FDA says the products made it to at least 10 other countries.

SUMMARY: "The children!" cries Linda Martinez, a retired pastor who came to the scene with a bouquet of flowers. "So young. I just can't believe it's real. We just have to help each other."
